description.en: Adds support for deCONZ's [raspbee/conbee] child devices

title.en: Remote has been rotated counter clockwise
title.nl: Afstandsbediening tegen de klok in gedraaid
Afstandsbediening met de klok mee gedraaid

title.en: Remote has been sharply rotated counter clockwise
title.nl: Afstandsbediening tegen de klok in gedraaid

title.en: Remote has been sharply rotated clockwise
title.nl: Afstandsbediening met de klok mee gedraaid

hint.en:
This setting will translate the actual measured rotation angle in a relative rotation angle that can be used to increase or decrease dim-level / volume.
xxÂ° = 100%
Range: 90 - 360, 
default: 180 [Â°]
By default the alarm will be triggered when the door/window get's detected as open. Using this setting you can invert this which enables a few interesting use cases
The sensor reports when there is no more motion detected. Using this setting you can increase the time (in seconds) until the motion alarm gets disabled.
Triggers an secondary no motion event after the motion alarm has been disabled. Usefull to generate Philips Hue like behaviour easily.

If a sensor is not properly calibrated it will read slightly wrong values. Using this setting you can adjust the sensor readings, i.e if you set a value of -2.5 and the sensor reports 20, the sensor will show a value of 17.5 within Homey.

If a sensor is not properly calibrated it will read slightly wrong values. Using this setting you can adjust the sensor readings, i.e if you set a value of -2.5 and the sensor reports 20, the sensor will show a value of 17.5 within Homey.

If a sensor is not properly calibrated it will read slightly wrong values. Using this setting you can adjust the sensor readings, i.e if you set a value of -2.5 and the sensor reports 20, the sensor will show a value of 17.5 within Homey.
Time after which the tilt alarm gets disabled after it has been triggered
Note that the sensitivity gets applied the next time the sensor performs a handshake with the conbee. This might take up to some time!
Hardware settings that are not yet applied to the sensor.
The sensor reports when there is no more motion detected. Using this setting you can increase the time (in seconds) until the motion alarm gets disabled.
Triggers an secondary no motion event after the motion alarm has been disabled. Usefull to generate Philips Hue like behaviour easily.

By default the alarm will be triggered when water is present. Using this setting you can invert this which enables a few interesting use cases
Transition time between brightnesses

Transition time between brightnesses

Let the led on the sensor flash every time motion is detected. Note that this setting gets applied the next time the sensor performs a handshake with the conbee. This might take up to some time!
Hardware settings that are not yet applied to the sensor.
